text_section1.text: You're fourteen, and this is the year 2095... Men probe the stars... Up there, a million strange worlds beckon... until you can stand it no longer... Until you set out on a ...
This yearning inside you -- it's like an ache, you look up -- up -- and when you see the trails of fire, your heart follows them...

text_section2.text: Dreaming again, Joey? I thought you'd be asleep by now!

text_section3.text: I-I'm just watching the rockets, Dad!

text_section1.text: Watching -- and wishing you were on board one of them, Joey!

text_section2.text: Yes, Dad -- it's so dull here! Nothing ever happens! If I could only be there -- if I could only be going somewhere... anywhere!!!

text_section1.text: I know, Joey! It must be dull for you! But I'm a prospector. Someday, maybe, I'll make a strike! Then you'll have your chance --
Maybe you'll get to the stars -- some day! But right now, hadn't you better be getting to bed, son?
Your father understands... but even that doesn't help! He says good night and then you lie there with the yearning tearing you apart, until it's just too much to bear...

text_section2.text: I've got to get away from here! I've got to see those other worlds! I've got to!

text_section1.text: The rocket port is on the other side of the desert... it's a long way... a dangerous way, but you've waited too long to turn back now!
Joey! No!!
Suddenly, you're free! You can almost touch the stars you're so hungry for! You stare ahead, eagerly --- and the miles whirl by...

text_section2.text: There it is... the rocket fort!! I'll get a job -- maybe as a cabin boy!

text_section1.text: ... And then, suddenly -- the engine dies!!
Empty! The fuel tank is empty! I'll crash!!
But you don't crash! The emergency stabilizer takes over... the platform rights itself... glides... and in a few seconds, there is a slight jar as you touch ground...

text_section2.text: I'm down --- but where? I'm still a long way from the rocket fort!

text_section1.text: You're down, yes... but you're far from safe! You back away... slowly! You begin to walk -- and great danger stalks you silently!
It-it's following me!
Forgotten, then, are your dreams of other worlds! -- you stumble on -- the hours pass. Then, at last, you can go no further...

text_section2.text: There's a rumbling in my head! It's no use... I'm too tired to keep going!

text_section1.text: The eyes of the cat-thing blaze at you with merciless cruelty! You realize that it is a creature of the desert... belongs here... and it is you who are the intruder...
... and, like the desert, it is about to close in on you...
Then it strikes!
But fortunately for you, it has waited too long!
When you turn, you see the most welcome sight in the world!

text_section2.text: ...Dad... Dad! I did hear a rumbling... Dad's half-track!

text_section1.text: When your father takes you in his arms, you cling to him, and he holds you until your trembling ceases...

text_section2.text: But how -- how did you find me?

text_section3.text: I saw you leave, Joey! It wasn't hard to guess where you were headed! -- I followed you and found the platform, so I looked for your trail!

text_section1.text: You were heading for the rocket port, weren't you? For the stars... but they will still be there.. when you grow up, Joey!
Dad, I-I'm sorry --

text_section2.text: It's all right, Joey. You made a mistake. Now, you know. You're not ready! But like I said, you'll make it... some day!

text_section1.text: So your father takes you home... you stare up at the Earth, yearning... and you hardly notice Deimos and Phobos, the two martian moons!
After all you were born on Mars -- its moons and the planet, Earth, above, are old stuff to you! What you're interested in is the universe beyond!
